issues.title: Validation Dashboard Complete Overhaul Using Unity UI Toolkit
observations: Two parallel OnGUI-based dashboards exist (HeatupValidationVisual and ValidationDashboard).
OnGUI cannot achieve modern professional aesthetics or smooth animations.
UI Toolkit POC documentation validates arc gauges and strip charts are viable in Unity 6.3.
HeatupSimEngine exposes 200+ parameters suitable for dashboard binding.

evidence.notes: Full specification with tab structure, animation requirements, and implementation stages.
POC validation confirming Painter2D arc gauges and strip charts work.
Source of all telemetry parameters for dashboard binding.

hypotheses: UI Toolkit with Painter2D can deliver professional animated dashboard with <2ms update cost at 5Hz.
issues.root_cause: Legacy OnGUI technology limits visual quality and prevents implementation of animated visualizations required for professional operator training interface.
issues.resolution_candidate: Implement complete UI Toolkit-based dashboard with animated pressurizer vessel, arc gauges, strip charts, and drill-down tab structure. Replace both legacy dashboards.
links: Assigned DP: DP-0008 - Operator Interface & Scenarios

issues.title: Pressurizer system audit - PlantConstants.Pressurizer parameter governance gaps
observations: Spray bypass flow constant remains at 1.5 gpm while referenced Westinghouse basis indicates 2.0 gpm total.
Pressurizer heater comments are stale/inconsistent with current authoritative baseline values.
Several pressurizer constants lack explicit source citations or engineering-basis annotations.

evidence.notes: Full constant-by-constant audit findings and proposed actions.

hypotheses: Pressurizer constant updates were partially applied across revisions without complete comment/source governance synchronization.
issues.root_cause: Parameter and documentation governance drift in `PlantConstants.Pressurizer.cs` left several values/comments/source annotations inconsistent with cited technical authority.
issues.resolution_candidate: Execute bounded constants-governance remediation: reconcile values with approved authority, update stale comments, and add missing citations/engineering-basis notes.
links: Assigned DP: DP-0012 - Pressurizer & Startup Control

issues.title: Pressurizer system audit - PressurizerPhysics engineering-basis and derivative fidelity gaps
observations: Flash evaporation currently uses fixed dTsat/dP=0.04 instead of pressure-dependent derivative behavior.
Solid pressurizer ambient-loss path uses hardcoded 50 kW reference while PlantConstants specifies 42.5 kW nominal.
Multiple engineering-estimate coefficients in PressurizerPhysics lack explicit design-basis citations.

evidence.notes: Physics audit findings with prioritized remediation options.
Current derivative/ambient-loss constants and phase-change paths.

hypotheses: Pressurizer physics model retained simplifications introduced during staged implementation and has not received a dedicated post-integration fidelity pass.
issues.root_cause: Engineering simplifications and uncited coefficients persisted in `PressurizerPhysics.cs` after earlier stabilization milestones, creating traceability and fidelity gaps.
issues.resolution_candidate: Run targeted physics-governance remediation: replace fixed derivative approximation, align ambient-loss authority, and document engineering basis for retained estimates.
links: Assigned DP: DP-0012 - Pressurizer & Startup Control

issues.title: Rotary selector switch UI control plan viability and integration risk assessment
observations: A revised rotary selector switch plan exists in `Updates/v2_RotarySelectorSwitch.md` defining a 2D UI control for PZR heater mode selection on Pressurizer screen.
Current operator-screen architecture is predominantly 2D uGUI mimic-based; recent RCS screen migration explicitly removed RenderTexture/3D path for consistency.

Scope is clarified: this selector is not simulator start/stop; OFF forces PZR heaters off while simulation continues, AUTO preserves current automatic heater behavior, MANUAL is reserved for future manual heater control.

evidence.notes: Revised v5.1.0 2D implementation plan with OFF/AUTO/MANUAL heater-mode semantics.
Current Screen 3 architecture and existing visual-only control surface.
Explicit design decision to avoid RenderTexture/3D path in operator screens.
Existing heater lifecycle/control authority path to map OFF/AUTO behavior without simulation shutdown.

hypotheses: The concept is viable if scope is constrained to existing 2D operator-screen patterns and explicit PZR heater authority boundaries.
issues.resolution_candidate: Perform full design investigation for 2D-native selector implementation and define deterministic heater-mode authority: OFF forces heater output to zero without stopping simulation, AUTO preserves current automatic behavior, MANUAL remains future-gated.
links: Assigned DP: DP-0012 - Pressurizer & Startup Control
Related systems: PressurizerScreen control panel, ScreenDataBridge read model, HeatupSimEngine heater control path
